intro: Lessingianthus rubricaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed sunflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and reddish stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous ray florets surrounding a central disk. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its bright color and ease of growth.
